title.native: 美少女戦士セーラームーン Crystal「デス・バスターズ編」
title.romaji: Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon: Crystal - Death Busters-hen

description:
Third cour of Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon: Crystal.

The new season will assemble all 10 Senshi — specifically, the popular outer Senshi such as Sailor Uranus, Sailor Neptune, and Sailor Saturn will join Sailor Moon, Sailor Chibi Moon, and the others. The new season will adapt the arc from the fifth and sixth volumes of the complete edition of Naoko Takeuchi's original Sailor Moon manga.
hashtag: #sailormoon #sailormooncrystal #セーラームーンCrystal #prettyguardian #セーラームーン

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Cyborg
tags.description: Prominently features a human character whose physiological functions are aided or enhanced by artificial means.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Fairy Tale
tags.description: This work tells a fairy tale, centers around fairy tales, or is based on a classic fairy tale.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

node.description: Naoko Takeuchi is a manga artist who lives in Tokyo, Japan. Takeuchi's works are widely admired by anime/manga fans. She is a well-known mangaka in the United States. Her most popular work, Sailor Moon, has been widely reprinted and marketed in North America. She also wrote the lyrics for a number of songs featured in the Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon anime and live-action series. They are mainly character-based image songs, but do include a few theme songs. She has won several awards including the 2nd Nakayoshi Comic Prize for Newcomers, for “Yume ja Nai no Ne,” in 1985. She also won for "Love Call" which won Nakayoshi's New Artist award which debuted in the Nakayoshi Deluxe September 1986 issue. In 1993 she won the 17th Kodansha Manga Award for shoujo for Sailor Moon. She is also married to the author of Hunter x Hunter and Yu Yu Hakusho, [Togashi Yoshihiro](https://anilist.co/staff/96893).
A Japanese anime director, storyboard artist, and animator.

[Official Website](https://www.momoclo.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/momoclo_king_pr) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6YNWTm6zuMFsjqd0PO3G-Q)

Momoiro Clover Z (abbreviated Momoclo) is a four member idol girl group represented by Stardust Promotion under Section 3's 3Bjunior. The group was formed in 2008, originally under the name Momoiro Clover. The group gradually garnered popularity and fanbase following their single debut in 2009 and major debut in 2010.

They are known for their energetic and acrobatic performances, color-coded system and unconventional concepts. 

Their sister group is [Shiritsu Ebisu Chuugaku](https://anilist.co/staff/149421/Shiritsu-Ebisu-Chuugaku).

[Profile](https://haikyo.co.jp/profile/profile.php?ActorID=11570) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/readingradio)

Her younger brother [Takashi Oohara](https://anilist.co/staff/96636/) is also a voice actor.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Harran - Goddess of Victory - Nikke (VG)
- Ningguang - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Mikasa - Azur Lane (VG)

__[Official Website](http://yakushimaruetsuko.com/)__ | __[Profile](http://yakushimaruetsuko.com/category/profile)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mirairecords)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mirairecords/)__

__Etsuko Yakushimaru__, alternatively known as Tika Alpha when writing lyrics and doing composition, is a Japanese singer, producer, composer, lyricist, arranger, artist, who is also a member and lead vocalist for the band [Soutaisei Riron](https://anilist.co/staff/152353/) (相対性理論).

[Profile (StarCrew)](https://www.starcrew.co.jp/talent/misatofukuen/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/misa0110) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/misato_fukuen/)

**Non-Anime Roles**:
• Sushang (Honkai Series)
• Hopper1 (Kamen Rider Gotchard)
• Eupha (Metaphor: ReFantazio)
• Natsume Iroha (Blue Archive)

__Height:__ 153 cm

Mitsuko Horie is a Japanese seiyuu and singer. She was born in Yamato, Kanagawa, Japan. She is most known to American anime fans as the voice of Sailor Galaxia, but in all Latin-America she is know as the "Candy-Candy" opening theme singer.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nojimakenji) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nojima_kenji/)__

Son of voice actor [Akio Nojima](https://anilist.co/staff/95918).
Younger brother of voice actor [Hirofumi Nojima](https://anilist.co/staff/95341).
Married to fellow voice actress [Chie Sawaguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/103731).

__Non-anime roles:__
- Albedo - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Caleb - Love and Deepspace (VG)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋晃_(アニメーター%29)

Affiliated with [Bandai Namco Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6116/). Noted for his work in the Precure franchise.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [other animator](https://anilist.co/staff/147908/)._

__[Official Website](http://yakushimaruetsuko.com/)__ | __[Profile](http://yakushimaruetsuko.com/category/profile)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mirairecords)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mirairecords/)__

__Etsuko Yakushimaru__, alternatively known as Tika Alpha when writing lyrics and doing composition, is a Japanese singer, producer, composer, lyricist, arranger, artist, who is also a member and lead vocalist for the band [Soutaisei Riron](https://anilist.co/staff/152353/) (相対性理論).

__[Official Website](http://yakushimaruetsuko.com/)__ | __[Profile](http://yakushimaruetsuko.com/category/profile)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mirairecords)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mirairecords/)__

__Etsuko Yakushimaru__, alternatively known as Tika Alpha when writing lyrics and doing composition, is a Japanese singer, producer, composer, lyricist, arranger, artist, who is also a member and lead vocalist for the band [Soutaisei Riron](https://anilist.co/staff/152353/) (相対性理論).

__[Website (MoltBeats)](http://moltbeats.com/)__ | __[Tumblr](https://motokiyamaguchi.tumblr.com/)__

__Introduction:__
Motoki Yamaguchi is a Japanese musician, drummer, record producer, composer, arranger and member of the band [Soutaisei Riron](https://anilist.co/staff/152353/Soutaisei-Riron) (相対性理論). 

__Biography:__
He has performed with various artists including Shing02, which might also be the collaboration he is best known for. He also does composition and arrangement for his own record label TIMTOMDISC.

__[Official Website](http://yakushimaruetsuko.com/)__ | __[Profile](http://yakushimaruetsuko.com/category/profile)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mirairecords)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mirairecords/)__
